post.title: A Memorable Trip to Poland

section.p: In Gdansk, I reunited with my close friend Lisa and her mother. Despite my exams, we explored the beautiful cities of Gdansk, Sopot, and Gdynia, each offering unique and memorable experiences.

Our visit to Warsaw was highlighted by a visit to the "Polin" museum, a profound experience that deepened my appreciation for history. Unexpectedly, a heavy snowfall in Warsaw led to a change in plans, with us spending hours in a caf√© to stay warm and dry.
This trip was more than just a vacation; it was a blend of adventure, cultural exploration, and the joy of rekindling long-distance friendships. It left me with memories I'll cherish forever.

section.p: My brief 17-hour stay in Genoa was a whirlwind of adventure, from a hidden rock beach accessed by yacht to exploring the night city, and ending with an early morning wait at the bus station with fresh focaccia in hand.

section.header: Milan: A Day of Galleries and Charming Hosts
section.p: In Milan, I indulged in a day of sightseeing and gallery visits, marveling at the city's beauty. The evening was spent with my host, sharing stories over delicious wine.

section.p: A quick trip to Como was a check off the list, while Florence brought food and rest, a sunstroke at the cathedral, and ended with a breathtaking rooftop party.

post.title: Italian Chronicles: Rome and Naples

section.p: Returning to Rome after years, I initially struggled to find a host. The scorching heat led me to a beach hangout, where I met Nikolas and his couchsurfer friends. This serendipitous encounter resulted in extending my stay by two days, immersing myself in Rome's unique charm.

section.header: Naples: A City of Vivid Impressions
section.p: In Naples, my journey was filled with late-night conversations, an early morning expedition to Pompei, cliff jumping in Sorento, and a night out that captured the city's intense energy. My final day was spent at the archeological museum, reflecting on Naples' striking character.

post.author: Veronica
post.title: Erasmus Adventure in Lithuania

section.p: Participating in the Erasmus project in Lithuania was a journey of discovery and creativity. Tasked with creating a documentary about Kamariskes Manor, I delved into the world of video and music editing, embracing the manor's cultural heritage and stunning natural surroundings.

Sharing a room with fellow Ukrainian participants, we formed a close-knit group, actively engaging in every project activity. From kayaking in the morning to working with professional equipment and dancing till the late hours, the experience was filled with energy, learning, and unforgettable moments.

These ten days were a blend of work, fun, and cultural exchange, leaving me with deep reflections and a sense of accomplishment. My time in Lithuania was a special chapter, marked by new friendships, skills, and a profound connection with the Erasmus community.

post.keywords: Erasmus, Lithuania, Kamariskes Manor, Documentary, Cultural Exchange
